RLHAB Gym Environment

class RLHAB_gym_DUAL.FlowFieldEnv3d_DUAL(FORECAST_ERA5, FORECAST_SYNTH, days=1, seed=None, render_mode=None, render_style='direction')[source]

Bases: Env

A custom Gym environment simulating 3D flow fields for high-altitude balloons.

This environment allows the agent to control the altitude of a balloon while considering two types of flow forecasts (ERA5 and synthetic). The goal is to perform station keeping within a defined radius around a target location.

Parameters:

  • FORECAST_ERA5 (Forecast) – ERA5 forecast object.

  • FORECAST_SYNTH (Forecast) – Synthetic forecast object.

  • days (int) – Number of days in the forecast subset.

  • seed (int, optional) – Random seed for reproducibility (default is None).

  • render_mode (str, optional) – Mode for rendering the environment (‘human’, ‘rgb_array’, etc.).

  • render_style (str, optional) – Visualization style for rendering (default is “direction”).

Variables:

  • radius (float) – Target station-keeping radius.

  • radius_inner (float) – Inner radius for reward calculation.

  • radius_outer (float) – Outer radius for metrics tracking.

  • dt (float) – Time step duration from the environment parameters.

  • action_space (gym.Space) – Discrete action space (Move Down, Stay, Move Up).

  • observation_space (gym.Space) – Dict space for altitude, distance, relative bearing, and flow field.

baseline_controller(obs)[source]

Given the current altitude and a list of relative flow column entries ([altitude, relative angle, speed]), this function returns the best altitude to transition to in order to minimize the relative angle and the action needed to reach that altitude.

Args: - obs (dict): Observation dictionary that contains the following keys:

  • ‘current_altitude’ (float): The current altitude.

  • ‘flow_field’ (list of lists): List of flow field entries [altitude, relative angle, speed].

Returns: - action (int): -1 for down, 0 for stay, 1 for up. - best_altitude (float): The altitude to transition to that minimizes the relative angle.

calculate_relative_angle(x, y, goal_x, goal_y, heading_x, heading_y)[source]

Calculates the relative angle of motion of the blimp in relation to the goal based off of true bearing FROM POSITION TO GOAL and the true heading. The relative angle of motion is then between 0 and 180 degrees, where…

If the balloon moves directly to the goal at one altitude, the value would be 0 degrees. Alternatively, if the balloon moved directly away from the goal at another altitude level, that would be 180 degrees.

Parameters:

  • x – current balloon x position

  • y – current balloon y position

  • goal_x

  • goal_y

  • heading_x – current balloon x velocity

  • heading_y – current balloon y velocity

Returns:

relative bearing of balloon motion in relation to goal

calculate_relative_wind_column()[source]

Builds off of the same calculation as calculate_relative_angle() to calculate the relative “flow map” vertical slice from the balloons current position between 0 and 180 degrees.

(z, magnitude, bearing) add uncertatinty later)

Returns:

flowfield with relative bearins and magnitude

close()[source]

After the user has finished using the environment, close contains the code necessary to “clean up” the environment.

This is critical for closing rendering windows, database or HTTP connections. Calling close on an already closed environment has no effect and won’t raise an error.

count_greater_than_zero(arr)[source]
metadata: dict[str, Any] = {'render.modes': ['human', 'rgb_array']}
move_agent(action)[source]

Update the balloon’s position and altitude based on the selected action.

Parameters:

action (int) – Action to take (0: Down, 1: Stay, 2: Up).

Returns:

reward (0 for now, no reward/penalty for moving).

Return type:

float

Reset the environment to its initial state.

  • options (dict, optional) – Additional reset options.

Observation and additional info.

reward_euclidian()[source]

Linear Euclidian reward within target region, google cliff function for outside of radius

reward_google()[source]

Google Loon’s reward function from the paper “Autonomous navigation of stratospheric balloons using reinforcement learning”

reward_piecewise()[source]

Compute the reward based on the balloon’s distance to the target.

Returns:

Reward value.

Return type:

float

Set the random seed for reproducibility.

Parameters:

seed (int, optional) – Random seed value.
